predicate.note: Frames file for 'eliminate' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry remove-10.1; other framed members include withdraw. I can't believe I haven't done 'remove' yet.

roleset.name: remove

example.name: relatively clear subject
example.text: Dan E. Nelms, Valley Federal's president and chief executive officer, said the one-time charge substantially eliminates future losses associated with the unit.
example.arg: future losses associated with the unit

example.name: stretching the subject
example.text: The plan calls for *trace* closing at least nine plants and eliminating about 3,600 jobs.

roleset.note: The plan isn't doing the eliminating, but rather some unnamed company which will be implementing the plan. But close enough.

example.name: unstated subject
example.text: *trace* Eliminate arbitrage and liquidity will decline instead of rising, creating more volatility instead of less.

example.name: untraceable subject
example.text: However, third-quarter operating profit fell 14%, as USX sold sizable chunks of its diversified and steel segments, *trace* eliminating income from those operations.

roleset.note: The subject of eliminate is "USX sold sizable chunks of its diversified and steel segments", but the syntax will not allow that string to be selected as target of the trace. So leave the trace with no target.
